p: Suspected bluetongue cases in sheep were first reported in the southern part of mainland China in 1974, and the virus was isolated in 1979 during an outbreak of bluetongue-like disease ( 133, 134). The prevalence of 12 BTV serotypes in mainland China was determined based on virus isolation ( 135). A probable novel serotype of BTV spread in the northwestern part of China in 2014 ( 136). Extensive research including risk analyses of BTV spread were conducted in areas with large sheep populations ( 137â€“ 139).
